dataset.title: Analysis of hydrocarbons following the Exxon Valdez oil spill, Gulf of Alaska, 1989 - 2014

creator.organizationName: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC) Auke Bay Laboratories (ABL)

associatedParty.organizationName: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis

abstract.para: This hydrocarbon database was initiated after the Exxon Valdez oil spill in 1989. The first version was as an RBase database, PWSOIL(Short, Heintz et al. 1996). It migrated to a proprietary structure in 1997, EVTHD (Exxon Valdez Oil Spill Trustee Council Hydrocarbon Database) and contained the collection and hydrocarbon analysis information for environmental samples obtained for the Exxon Valdez National Resource Damage Assessment and Restoration efforts. The data were organized into three matrix types, tissues, sediment, and seawater. The analytical results included concentrations of 63 hydrocarbons, summary statistics for the evaluation of the hydrocarbon sources and laboratory quality control data. Features of the database included identification of replicate samples, presentation of results in dry or wet weight, optional correction for method detection limits (MDL) of the analytes, and easy identification of samples contaminated with Exxon Valdez crude oil. This structure, written in Visual Basic, ceased to function well when Windows operating systems were upgraded to XP and the data were moved to a Microsoft Access format. The 2014 version continues in Access and is described in the included lexicon document. The 2014 version also includes a data analysis tool (Excel Office 2007 or greater) that flags recovery problems, provides method detection limit filtration (MDL), and source oil modeling. The data should not be used without understanding these details. Further instructions are in the lexicon document. These data are included here as exported csv files of the individual tables from the original MS Access database file available at http://portal.aoos.org/gulf-of-alaska.php#metadata/91b73240-b68d-43d8-bd64-aea4ea14e976/project/files. The DataDownload.R script used to download these csv files is also included here. The data have been manipulated and combined using the R script below (Total_PAH_and_Alkanes_GoA_Hydrocarbons_Clean.R), and output into the Total_Aromatic_Alkanes_PWS.csv file.

dataTable.entityDescription: Combined dataset from PAH, Alkane and Sample tables documenting samples collected after the Exxon Valdez oil spill in Prince William Sound, AK

attribute.attributeDefinition: Funding source for sample collected

codeDefinition.definition: Exxon Valdez Oil Spill Trustee Council

attribute.attributeDefinition: Sample Identification Numbers uniquely identify each sample
Rep is sample replicate number and is determined by the analytical laboratory
Identifies the laboratory where the analysis was performed (Auke Bay Laboratory)

codeDefinition.definition: Geochemical and Environmental Research Group, Texas A&M

attribute.attributeDefinition: Sample string; structure is either Ammddy, where A = analyst's initial or "R" for restoration, mm = month, dd = day, and yy = year or yyyy-mmddAA, where yyyy = year, mm = month, dd = day, and AA are analyst's initials
String matrix. Contains the same basic information as Analysis type - but a single string can have more than one matrix represented.
Sample volume in milliliters (water only)
Proportion of passive sample analyzed (generally 0.5 or 1)
Sample dry weight in grams
Sample wet weight in grams
Each matrix is processessed according to a specific method. These methods are PEMD (passive samplers), SPMD (an alternative passive sampler), sediment, tissue, water
Alphanumeric identifier to track groups of samples released by the database manager to an analytical laboratory for analysis
comment
Sum of all measured polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAH) from PAH table (including "DIMETH"", "TRIMETH", and "MEPHEN1"; see "TPAH_adj" for sum excluding these three anlaytes)
Sum of measured polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAH) from PAH table, excluding "DIMETH"", "TRIMETH", and "MEPHEN1"
Total alkane concentration, including both calibrated and uncalibrated compounds
Optional sample depth in meters, measured from mean lower low water (MLLW) as measured or estimated by the sample collector
Abbreviated names for Exxon Valdez Trustee Natural Resource Damage Assessment and Restoration projects

Provides the project number assigned by the funding agency (required for EVOSTC projects). For further project detail, use projectCode with the EVOSTC website search engine (http://www.evostc.state.ak.us/Projects/SearchStart.cfm)
Alphanumeric identifier assigned to the sample by field personnel or the principal investigator.
Method used to collect the sample. See table Collection Methods for further detail.
Identifies sample type. Valid sample types (as of 2013) are agarose, blank, coal, creosote, oil, suspended particulate matter (PARTICLT), peat, PEMD, sediment, SPMD, tissue, rinse, and water.
Specific additional information about matrix [such as WHOLE (whole specimen), egg, stomach, tarball and asphalt].
Species used for tissue samples. See table species for further explanation
Date sample was collected (required).
Year sample was collected (required)
General sample collection area (required); see table LOCATION for abbreviations. Location refers to general areas, not specific latitudes and longitudes. Lat and Long also provided.
Last name of individual responsible for the collecting, handling, and security of field samples.
Organization responsible for sample collection

codeDefinition.definition: NOAA National Marine Fisheries Service, Auk Bay Labs
Alaska Dept of Fish and Game
NOAA National Marine Fisheries Service, Kodiak
Univ of Alaska, Institute of Marine Science
Univ of Alaska, Institute of Arctic Biology
NOAA National Marine Fisheries Service, ECD
NOAA National Marine Fisheries Service, MML

attribute.attributeDefinition: Latitude in decimal degrees
Longitude in decimal degrees

Identifies the type of sample: ENV = environmental, EXP = experimental, blank = blank sample for quality assurance purposes, spike = spiked blank, OTHR = other type of sample (e.g., samples collected to test municipal water supply).
Identifier of reliability of the analytical results for individual samples. Good = no problems, BIAS = probable problems with the analytical data (Short et al. 1996b)
Collection method abbreviation as designated in data tables
Description of collection method

otherEntity.entityDescription: R script used to combine PAH.csv, alkane.csv and samples.csv datasets into one datatable. Formatting and cleaning were also done using this script and the Non-EVOS_SINs.csv file included in this data package.
R script used to plot sample locations in the Gulf of Alaska and Northern Gulf of Alaska with sample type represented in colors

otherEntity.entityName: Map of sampling locations in the Northern Gulf of Alaska
otherEntity.entityDescription: Map of where hydrocarbon samples were collected in the Northern Gulf of Alaska with sample type designated by color.

otherEntity.entityName: Map of sampling locations in the Gulf of Alaska
otherEntity.entityDescription: Map of where hydrocarbon samples were collected in the broader Gulf of Alaska with sample type designated by color.
R script used to download PAH.csv, Alkane.csv, Sample.csv, and CollectionMethods.csv from the original MS Access database.
